question: It is centered around fictional creatures called "Pokémon", which humans capture and __________ to fight each other for sport.
title: Pokémon

question: The __________ began as a pair of video games for the original Game Boy, developed by Game Freak and published by Nintendo.
title: Pokémon

question: The __________ now spans video games, trading card games, animated television shows and movies, comic books, and toys.
title: Pokémon

question: Pokémon is the second-most successful and __________ __________ game-based media franchise in the world, behind only Nintendo's Mario franchise.
title: Pokémon

question: The __________ celebrated its tenth anniversary in 2006.
title: Pokémon

question: Cumulative sales of the __________ __________ (including home console versions, such as "Hey You, Pikachu!"
title: Pokémon

question: In November 2005, 4Kids Entertainment, which had managed the non-game related __________ of Pokémon, announced that it had agreed not to renew the Pokémon representation agreement.
title: Pokémon

question: Pokémon USA Inc. (now The Pokémon Company International), a __________ of Japan's Pokémon Co., now oversees all Pokémon licensing outside of Asia.
title: Pokémon

question: The series centers on an __________ __________ between humanity and a theocratic alliance of aliens known as the Covenant.
title: Halo (series)

question: The Covenant, led by their religious leaders called the Prophets, __________ an ancient civilization known as the Forerunners, who perished in combat with the parasitic Flood.
title: Halo (series)

question: The __________ __________ of the franchise builds off the experiences of Master Chief John-117, one of a group of supersoldiers codenamed Spartans, and his artificial intelligence (AI) companion, Cortana.
title: Halo (series)

question: The __________ "Halo" refers to the Halo rings: large, habitable structures that were created by the Forerunners to destroy all sentient life.
title: Halo (series)

question: They are similar to the Orbitals in Iain M. Banks' Culture novels, and __________ Larry Niven's Ringworld concept.
title: Halo (series)

question: The games in the series have been praised as being among the best __________ __________ on a video game console, and are considered the Xbox's "killer app".
title: Halo (series)

question: This has led to the __________ "Halo killer" being used to describe console games that aspire, or are considered, to be better than Halo.
title: Halo (series)

question: Fueled by the __________ of Halo: Combat Evolved, and immense marketing campaigns from publisher Microsoft, its sequels went on to break various sales records.
title: Halo (series)

question: Halo 3 sold more than __________ million worth of copies in the first twenty-four hours of release, breaking the record set by Halo 2 three years prior.
title: Halo (series)

question: Halo: Reach, in turn, broke the __________ set by Halo 3, selling US$200 million worth of copies on its first day of release.
title: Halo (series)

question: Continuing the __________, Halo 4 broke Halo: Reach '​s record on its opening day by grossing US$220 million.
title: Halo (series)

question: Strong sales of the games led to the franchise__________ __________ to other media; there are multiple bestselling novels, graphic novels, and other licensed products.
title: Halo (series)

question: Halo Wars took the __________ into new video game genre territory, as it is a real-time strategy game, while the rest of the games in the series are first-person shooters.
title: Halo (series)

question: Beyond the __________ __________, Bungie developed the expansion Halo 3: ODST, and a prequel, Halo: Reach, their last project for the franchise.
title: Halo (series)

question: A high-definition remake of the first __________ entitled Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary was released on November 15, 2011, exactly ten years after the release of the original.
title: Halo (series)

question: A __________ __________ in a second series of games, Halo 4, was released on November 6, 2012.
title: Halo (series)

question: Halo: The Master Chief Collection, a graphically remastered __________ of the four primary Halo titles, was released for the Xbox One on November 11, 2014.
title: Halo (series)

question: The __________ __________ of the Halo series has been compared by writer Brian Bendis to that of Star Wars.
title: Halo (series)

question: The __________ __________ of fans of the series is referred to as the "Halo Nation".
title: Halo (series)

question: is an annual American __________ __________ honoring cinematic achievements in the film industry.
title: Academy Awards

question: The various __________ __________ are awarded a copy of a statuette, officially the Academy Award of Merit, that is better known by its nickname Oscar.
title: Academy Awards

question: The awards, first presented in 1929 at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel, are overseen by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (__________).
title: Academy Awards

question: The __________ __________ was first televised in 1953 and is now seen live in more than 200 countries.
title: Academy Awards

question: The Oscars is also the oldest entertainment __________ __________; its equivalents, the Emmy Awards for television, the Tony Awards for theatre, and the Grammy Awards for music and recording, are modeled after the Academy Awards.
title: Academy Awards

question: The __________ __________ Awards ceremony was held on March 2, 2014, at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles, later than usual as to not clash with the Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia.
title: Academy Awards

question: The __________ Academy Awards is scheduled for February 22, 2015.
title: Academy Awards

question: The Republic of China, originally based in __________ China, now governs the island of Taiwan, which makes up over 99% of its territory, as well as Penghu, Kinmen, Matsu, and other minor islands.
title: Taiwan

question: Neighboring states include the People's Republic of China to the __________, Japan to the east and northeast, and the Philippines to the south.
title: Taiwan

question: Taipei is the __________ of the central government.
title: Taiwan

question: New Taipei, encompassing the __________ __________ surrounding Taipei proper, is the most populous city.
title: Taiwan

question: The __________ of Taiwan (formerly known as "Formosa") was mainly inhabited by Taiwanese aborigines until the Dutch and Spanish settlement during the Age of Discovery in the 17th century, when Han Chinese began immigrating to the island.
title: Taiwan

question: In 1662, the pro-Ming __________ Koxinga expelled the Dutch and established the first Han Chinese polity on the island, the Kingdom of Tungning.
title: Taiwan

question: The Qing Dynasty of China later defeated the __________ and annexed Taiwan.
title: Taiwan

question: By the __________ Taiwan was ceded to Japan in 1895, the majority of Taiwan's inhabitants were Han Chinese either by ancestry or by assimilation.
title: Taiwan

question: The Republic of China (__________) was established in China in 1912.
title: Taiwan

question: After Japan's __________ in 1945, the ROC assumed its control of Taiwan.
title: Taiwan

question: Following the Chinese __________ __________, the Communist Party of China took full control of mainland China and founded the People's Republic of China (PRC) in 1949.
title: Taiwan

question: The __________ relocated its government to Taiwan, and its jurisdiction became limited to Taiwan and its surrounding islands.
title: Taiwan

question: In 1971, the PRC assumed China's __________ at the United Nations, which the ROC originally occupied.
title: Taiwan

question: __________ __________ of the ROC has gradually eroded as most countries switched recognition to the PRC.
title: Taiwan

question: 21 UN __________ __________ and the Holy See currently maintain official diplomatic relations with the ROC.
title: Taiwan

question: It has unofficial ties with most other states via its __________ __________.
title: Taiwan

question: The PRC has threatened the __________ of military force as a response to any formal declaration of Taiwanese independence, or if it deems peaceful reunification no longer possible.
title: Taiwan

question: Cross-Strait relations as well as issues of __________ __________ within the country are important factors in Taiwanese politics and a cause of social and political division among political parties and their respective supporters.
title: Taiwan

question: During the __________ half of the 20th century, Taiwan experienced rapid economic growth and industrialization and is now an advanced industrial economy.
title: Taiwan

question: In the 1980s and early 1990s, Taiwan evolved into a __________ __________ with universal suffrage.
title: Taiwan

question: Taiwan is one of the Four Asian Tigers and a __________ of the WTO and APEC.
title: Taiwan

question: The __________ __________ in the world, its high-tech industry plays a key role in the global economy.
title: Taiwan

question: Taiwan is ranked highly in terms of freedom of the press, health care, public education, __________ __________, and human development.
title: Taiwan

title: Taiwan

title: Taiwan

title: Taiwan

title: Taiwan

title: Taiwan

title: Taiwan

title: Taiwan

title: Taiwan

question: Located in Western New York on the eastern shores of Lake Erie and at the __________ of the Niagara River across from Fort Erie, Ontario, Canada, Buffalo is the principal city of the Buffalo-Niagara Falls metropolitan area, the largest in Upstate New York and 45th largest in the United States.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: As of the 2010 U.S Census, the __________ proper had a population of 261,310, making the city the 69th largest city in the United States and the second most populous in the state after New York City.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: The Buffalo–Niagara–Cattaraugus Combined Statistical Area is __________ to 1,215,826 residents.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: Originating around 1789 as a small __________ community near the eponymous Buffalo Creek, Buffalo grew quickly after the opening of the Erie Canal in 1825, with the city as its western terminus.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: By 1900, Buffalo was the __________ largest city in the United States, and went on to become a major railroad hub, and the largest grain-milling center in the country.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: The __________ part of the 20th century saw a reversal of fortunes: Great Lakes shipping was rerouted by the opening of the St. Lawrence Seaway, and steel mills and other heavy industry relocated to places such as China.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: By 1990, the __________ had fallen back below its 1960 population levels.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: __________, the region's largest economic sectors are financial services, technology, health care and education, and these continue to grow despite the lagging national and worldwide economies.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: In recent years, expansions of the Buffalo Niagara Medical Campus and the The State University of New York have led to private and __________ __________ throughout the city and region.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: A __________ __________ found Buffalo's April 2014 unemployment rate to be 5.8%.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: In 2010, Forbes rated Buffalo the __________ best place to raise a family in the United States.
title: Buffalo, New York

question: Nicknames for the city of Buffalo include "The __________ __________", Buffalo's most common moniker; "The Nickel City," due to the appearance of a bison on the back of Indian Head nickel in the early part of the 20th century, "The City of Good Neighbors,"  and less commonly, the "City of Light."
title: Buffalo, New York
